timeline.bodyText:
If you want to log the stack trace you need log.error(e, e).
If you don't, please add a comment saying so because it's surprising to hide it.
timeline.author: efge

replies.bodyText: Yes no special reason to hide the stack! Fixed!
replies.author: NourNuxeo

timeline.message: NXP-28798: Gracefully log missing document routs

timeline.bodyText:
If a sysadmin can't do much about it and the application can keep functioning, I'd prefer a WARN.
Also where is the exception being thrown exactly? Could you add a full stack trace in the NXP ticket please. I'm asking because the try/catch has a very large scope, which is bad if we can have a smaller one.
From a quick test it seems to appear in nodeAccessRunner.runUnrestricted() so the try/catch should be around that, and you should log.warn("Failed to get workflow instance", e)
timeline.author: efge

replies.bodyText:
Making it a warn and updating the ticket!
Yes indeed, I just catched there because there was already a try clause and because I was certain about the context this is called in (by context I mean while writing a task to json). The UnrestrictedSessionRunner.runUnrestricted() is called in so many places I didn't want to catch in it.
I could also make a sub try catch around the nodeAccessRunner.runUnrestricted();call in TaskWriter.writeEntityBody() line 116. to make sure I only catch errors on the runUnrestricted().
At first I wanted to avoid doing a sub try catch.
replies.author: NourNuxeo

replies.bodyText: Yes I mean around the call to nodeAccessRunner.runUnrestricted at line 116. It helps the reader to know where the exception can come from.
replies.author: efge

replies.bodyText: After moving the catch, now the faulty task contains more info in the response. I have updated the jira ticket with a response containing a corrupted task first and then a well formed one. Also Kevin has identified some issues we'd like to have your opinion about: #4008 (comment)
replies.author: NourNuxeo

timeline.bodyText: Why not fixing the root cause in NodeAccessRunner instead of catching?
timeline.author: kevinleturc

replies.bodyText:
As we discussed on slack the root cause is a DocumentNotFound exception we can only catch where we need to.
We have identified other issues as well:

the NodeAccessRunner is also called by org.nuxeo.ecm.platform.routing.core.io.TaskCompletionRequestJsonReader.readEntity(JsonNode)
When we list the tasks, corrupted tasks show, but obviously miss information, which we may want to avoid in the UI.
Here is a sample response with a first corrupted task and a well formed task:
https://jira.nuxeo.com/browse/NXP-28798?focusedCommentId=453928&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-453928
replies.author: NourNuxeo

timeline.bodyText:
As @efge said in one of his comments, you should log something meaningful if possible:
log.warn("Failed to get workflow instance", e)

BTW, do we want the whole stack trace for a WARN? (cc @kevinleturc)
timeline.author: troger

replies.bodyText: I would say no as this is a valid error case, I'm wondering if we still want it behind a debug/trace level.
replies.author: kevinleturc
troger

timeline.author: troger

replies.bodyText:
At the begining the catch was at the end of the try resource (way more line below) so I explained why I was catching.
I should have removed it when I made a very local try catch
replies.author: NourNuxeo
